descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of injury prevention techniques related to athletic, social, or motor vehicle activities.
Shows minimal understanding of injury prevention, with significant gaps in knowledge.
Displays basic understanding of injury prevention but struggles to apply it to different activities.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of injury prevention techniques and can apply them to some activities.
Exhibits a comprehensive understanding of injury prevention and consistently applies it across various activities.
Demonstrates expert-level understanding and application of injury prevention, adapting strategies to unique situations and promoting safety effectively.
Does not apply any injury prevention strategies in practical scenarios.
Attempts to apply prevention strategies but does so incorrectly or ineffectively.
Applies some prevention strategies correctly in familiar situations but struggles in new or complex scenarios.
Consistently applies appropriate prevention strategies in a variety of common situations.
Proactively applies prevention strategies and adapts them effectively to different contexts.
Models and promotes injury prevention strategies, demonstrating a commitment to safety in all activities and encouraging others to do the same.
Shows no awareness of potential injury risks in athletic, social, or motor vehicle activities.
Displays limited awareness of risks and does not recognize potential hazards.
Identifies some common risks but may overlook less obvious dangers.
Demonstrates good awareness of common risks and takes steps to mitigate them.
Exhibits strong awareness of a wide range of risks and proactively identifies potential hazards.
Expertly assesses risks and implements comprehensive strategies to minimize potential injuries, demonstrating leadership in promoting safety culture.
